channel.title: Posts on PHYSCI 70: Digital Fabrication

item.title: Week 1
item.description: For the first week of class, we experimented with microcontrollers, building our first circuits on breadboards. Loosely following a guide introducing basic electronics, I built a circuit using the Adafruit ItsyBitsy M4 controller. The circuit I set out to build can be represented in the following diagram: For power source (5V) and ground (GND), I used the 3V and GND terminals of the microcontroller respectively. After fun stripping and cutting wires, I assembled the circuit as shown below:
